transcript: not even wish to know of his existence but would now have been offended and grieved had he chosen not to see them. These differ- ent people businessmen, relations, and ac- quaintances alike were all disposed to treat the young heir in the most friendly and flatter- ing manner: they were all evidently firmly con- vinced of Pierre's noble qualities. He was always hearing such words as: "With your re- markable kindness," or, "With your excellent heart," "You are yourself so honorable, Count,"
